title: Baked Italian Chicken Dinner Recipe
description: Use this recipe to easily make a baked chicken main dish with potatoes, broccoli, and Italian dressing mix.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Baked Italian Chicken Dinner 4.1 (132) 102 Reviews 34 Photos This baked Italian chicken dinner is one of the easiest and most requested recipes. It's simple to make, and the ingredients are easy to find! Submitted by AmyZ Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 34 34 34 34 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings cooking spray 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into cubes 1 (10 ounce) package frozen broccoli 4 potatoes, diced ¼ cup butter, melted 1 (.7 ounce) package Italian dressing mix Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Layer chicken, broccoli, and potatoes evenly into the prepared baking dish in the order listed. Drizzle melted butter over the top. Sprinkle with Italian dressing mix. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, 45 to 60 minutes. Rock_lobster I Made It Print 377 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Italian Chicken Dinner 01 of 34 Photo by  Rock_lobster 02 of 34 Photo by  Kimi 04/16/2023 I changed it almost completely because I didn’t have the Italian dressing mix, all I had was ranch. So I added that with the chicken, broccoli, brussel sprouts, and onions. I baked for 1 hour and 15 minutes then added one (1) can of drained corn and cooked another 10 minutes @ 350. 03 of 34 Photo by  karysta 08/09/2021 04 of 34 Photo by  Angela Venegas 07/26/2021 05 of 34 Photo by  chefdad77 01/05/2021 06 of 34 Photo by  Dawn Renee 12/10/2020 07 of 34 Photo by  Olivia Dong 09/01/2020 08 of 34 Photo by  LATISHA MOSHER 08/30/2020 VERY DELICIOUS . MADE A SERVING FOR 8 PEOPLE. AND I ALSO ADDED GARLIC POWDER, ITALIAN SEASONING, AND SALT AND PEPPER. I ALSO MIXED THE DRESSING MIX INTO THE MELTED BUTTER. MY WAS MY FIRST TIME MAKING THIS AND IT WAS PERFECT WITH THE SEASONING ADDED TO IT. 09 of 34 Photo by  LATISHA MOSHER 08/30/2020 VERY DELICIOUS . MADE A SERVING FOR 8 PEOPLE. AND I ALSO ADDED GARLIC POWDER, ITALIAN SEASONING, AND SALT AND PEPPER. I ALSO MIXED THE DRESSING MIX INTO THE MELTED BUTTER. MY WAS MY FIRST TIME MAKING THIS AND IT WAS PERFECT WITH THE SEASONING ADDED TO IT. 10 of 34 Photo by  Mark Clancy 08/28/2020 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love BBQ Chicken Pouches 5 Ratings Crunchy French Onion Chicken 349 Ratings Simple Baked Chicken Breasts 515 Ratings Chicken Dorito Casserole 39 Ratings Last Minute Chicken Dinner 167 Ratings Mexi-Chicken Avocado Cups 50 Ratings Grilled Chicken, Peach, and Arugula Salad 40 Ratings Emergency Chicken 471 Ratings Baked Lemon-Rosemary Chicken 3 Ratings Terry's Favorite Easy Chicken Pie 107 Ratings Garlic-Brown Sugar Chicken Breasts 1 Rating Zucchini Lunchixa 5 Ratings Easy Baked Chicken Tenders 75 Ratings Lime-Berry Chicken Salad 28 Ratings Quick Chicken and Stuffing Casserole 54 Ratings Easy Chicken Breast Wrapped in Bacon 32 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: AmyZ
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.;Layer chicken, broccoli, and potatoes evenly into the prepared baking dish in the order listed. Drizzle melted butter over the top. Sprinkle with Italian dressing mix.;Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender, 45 to 60 minutes. Rock_lobster
